meanings.english_definition: (Latin) age, lifetime, period of time; generation, an age (of man); a period (of history)

etymology.value: From Proto-Italic *aiwos, from Proto-Indo-European *h₂óyus (“lifetime, age”). Cognate with Sanskrit ā́yus (“life, vitality”), Avestan āiiu- (“age, lifetime”), Ancient Greek αἰών (aiṓn, “age, lifetime”).

usage_notes.explanation: 'Aetas' is a Latin noun primarily referring to a period of time, age, or generation. It is important to note the declension to use it correctly in Latin sentences.
